docs.lead_paragraph: When Thierry Desmarest joined the French oil company Total as an exploration expert 19 years ago, most of Total's shareholders were French -- including the French state, with a 35 percent stake -- and most of its profit was made in France. Its far larger domestic rival, Elf Aquitaine, was mainly a Government fief run by bureaucrats. Mr. Desmarest, now the chairman at 53, mused in a recent conversation that it would be ''difficult to imagine'' Total contemplating a merger with Elf back then.

headline.main: Embracing la Nouvelle Economie; String of Big Deals Elevates France in Europe and World

docs.abstract: French economy is gaining strength as its big companies flex their muscles in global competition; stock market is up sharply, economic growth has recently been robust, unemployment is beginning to shrink and consumers, while not overly optimistic, are feeling better about their prospects than they have in years; string of big corporate deals has elevated France in Europe and world; battle between Elf Aquitaine and Total Fina to acquire each other is discussed along with several other merger efforts as examples of new and inventive alliances being undertaken by French corporations; graphs; charts; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Hooper Holmes Inc., which provides health information on policy applicants to insurance companies, said yesterday that it had agreed to buy a unit of Pediatric Services of America Inc. for as much as $95 million, gaining control of its biggest rival. The unit, Paramedical Services of America, collects blood and urine samples from candidates for life and health policies and runs more than 200 centers nationwide. Hooper Holmes, based in Basking Ridge, N.J., has a similar number of offices. The price of the deal is subject to adjustment but is expected to be $85 million to $95 million, Hooper Holmes said. Hooper Holmes specializes in medical examinations and tests in homes and businesses of policy applicants.

headline.main: HOOPER HOLMES TO BUY RIVAL COMPANY IN HEALTH TESTING

docs.abstract: Hooper Holmes Inc acquires Paramedical Services of America, unit of Pediatric Services of America Inc, for as much as $95 million (S)
